question: Aristotle was one of the firsts to attempt to codify "thinking". His _________ provided patterns of argument structure that always gave correct conclusions, given correct premises.
Turing test or Imitation Game, was put forth as a simple test that could be used to _______

John McCarthy is one of the "founding fathers" of artificial intelligence, together with Marvin Minsky, Allen Newell, and Herbert A. Simon proposed a study in the Summer of 1956 to proceed on the basis of the conjecture that

options.option: The fundamental goal [of AI research] is not merely to mimic intelligence or produce some clever fake.
Every aspect of learning or any other feature of intelligence can in principle be so precisely described that a machine can be made to simulate it.
Weak AI aims at building machines that act intelligently, without taking a position on whether or not the machines actually are intelligent.
The ultimate goal of AI, which we are very far from achieving, is to build a person, or, more humbly, an animal.

question: Overall computational cost of a AI Production System is in two major categories: Rule Application Cost and Control Strategy Cost. For an Uninformed Control System, we have the following:

options.option: Low Rule Application Cost and High Control Strategy Cost
Low Rule Application Cost and Low Control Strategy Cost
High Rule Application Cost and Low Control Strategy Cost
High Rule Application Cost and High Control Strategy Cost

question: There are two distinct specialized production systems; Order in which a set of applicable rules are applied to a database is unimportant for a ________ production system.

For more complex games, such as chess or checker the AND/OR search to termination is out of question. Which of the following statements are true?
I. Our goal in searching such a game tree might be, instead, merely to find a good first move.
II. Extract from the search graph an estimate of the ‘best’ first move.

options.option: Both I and II are false.

question: The AO* algorithm can best be seen as the following TWO major operations:

options.option: Step I: Top-down: graph-growing; Step II: Bottom-up: cost-revising, SOLVE-labelling.
Step I: Bottom-up: graph-growing; Step II: Top-down: cost-revising, SOLVE-labelling.
Step I: Top-down: graph-growing, SOLVE-labelling; Step II: Bottom-up: cost-revising.
Step I: Bottom-up: graph-growing, SOLVE-labelling; Step II: Top-down: cost-revising.

question: Domain knowledge is used to make preferential choice between the child nodes in ________
The ___________is a way of combining the advantages of both depth-first and breadth-first search into a single method.
For bidirectional search is a graph search algorithm that runs two simultaneous searches. Which of the following statements is false for bidirectional search?

options.option: Requires the ability to generate predecessor states.
Works well only when there are unique start and goal states.

question: Domain knowledge is used to make preferential choice between the child nodes in_________
In heuristic search, the heuristic function, h(n), of a node n estimates the__________

options.option: Cost to a goal from the current node n
Cost from the start to the current node n
Overall cost of the path through the node n

question: The principal gain, often spectacular, of using a heuristic function is the________

options.option: Estimate of a path to the goal

question:
There is a special class of heuristics called admissible heuristics, which possess some desirable properties.
Which of the following statements are true for an admissible heuristic?
I. They are optimistic heuristics because they can only underestimate the cost
II. Never returns a value greater than the actual path cost to the nearest goal for any node

A* generates an optimal solution under which of the following conditions?
Condition 1: If h(n) is an admissible heuristic and the search space is a tree
Condition 2: If h(n) is a consistent heuristic and the search space is a graph

options.option: A* never generate an optimal solution

question: Identify the properties of the Hill-climbing algorithm

options.option: Terminates when a peak is reached
Does not look ahead of the immediate neighbors of the current state
Chooses randomly among the set of best successors

question:
Combine hill-climbing with a random walk in some way to get both efficiency and completeness.
Simulated annealing is one such algorithm.
Which of the following statements are true for simulated annealing?

options.option: It determines (through a probability function) the amplitude of the steps, long at the beginning, and then shorter and shorter
It is a stochastic hill-climbing algorithm
The very structure of the algorithm decreases the execution time
The random steps possibly allow to avoid small “hills”

question:
A solution to a CSP is a complete assignment that satisfies all the constraints. Which of the two are true for a solution to a CSP?
I. An assignment that does not violate any constraints is called consistent or legal
II. A complete assignment is one in which every variable is mentioned
Arc Consistency is a method of constraint propagation. The following is incorrect for arc consistency

options.option: Forward checking is substantially stronger than arc consistency
Arc consistency must be applied repeatedly until no more inconsistencies remain
Provides a fast method of constraint propagation

question:
Conflict-Directed Backjumping is better than Simple Backjumping because:
I. When a partial solution cannot be extended, the algorithm backtracks to the latest choice point
II. When a contradiction occurs, remember the minimum set of variables from the conflict set that was responsible for the problem
In the pay-off matrix of a zero-sum game, an outcome is a __________ if the outcome is a minimum in its row and maximum in its column.
The AO* algorithm can best be seen as the following TWO major operations:

Which of the following statements are true for searching an AND-OR graph?
I. To find solution in an AND-OR graph we need an algorithm similar to best-first search; but with the ability to handle the AND arc appropriately
II. Algorithm should find a path from the start node to a set of nodes representing the solution states

For more complex games, such as chess or checker the AND/OR search to termination is out of question. Which of the following statements are true?
I. Our goal in searching such a game tree might be, instead, merely to find a good first move
II. Extract from the search graph an estimate of the ‘best’ first move

For complex games such as chess or checkers, a good first move can be extracted by a procedure called the Minimax.
The minimax value is the backed-up value of the root from all the leaves.
Identify the correct statements w.r.t the minimax for such a game tree

options.option: The minimax rule backs up values from the children of a node; given a static evaluation function for the tip nodes
Represents the outcome when both the players play perfectly
Backed-up values identify  the best move for each player
For a MAX node, it backs up the maximum of the values of the children

question:
Alpha-beta pruning is a layering on top of minimax.
Identify the correct statements w.r.t alpha-beta pruning

options.option: Alpha-beta pruning is an optimization technique for minimax algorithm
Alpha-beta pruning cuts off branches in the game tree which need not be searched because there already exists a better move available
Alpha-beta pruning is guaranteed to compute the same value for the root node as computed by minimax
For alpha-beta pruning one traverses the search tree in depth-first order

question: Given a MIN node n; cutoff search below n, if beta(n) ≤ alpha(i) for some MAX node ancestor i of n, we have_______________cut-off
Given a MAX node n; cutoff search below n, if alpha(n) ≥ beta(i) for some MIN node ancestor i of n, we have__________cut-off
____________is usually used in conjunction with alpha-beta so that a reasonably good move can be returned even if the algorithm is interrupted before it has finished execution
There exist algorithms that use the__________ for traversing a game tree, which are more time-efficient. But typically, at a heavy cost in space-efficiency

A physical symbol system has the necessary and sufficient means for general intelligent action.
Identify the correct statements with regards to Symbol System Hypothesis

options.option: Knowledge may be represented as symbol structures.
Represents a computational system inspired by the human brain.
Intelligent behaviour can be achieved through manipulation of symbol structures.
Human thinking is a kind of symbol manipulation.

question:
A knowledge representation is fundamentally a ___________;
a substitute for the thing itself used to enable an entity to determine consequences by reasoning about the world.
Identify the statements that are true for propositional logic.

options.option: Can directly talk about properties of individuals or relations between individuals
Generalizations, patterns, regularities can't easily be represented
A propositional variable represents an arbitrary proposition

question: Consider which of the following statements are correct w.r.t. entailment in first-order logic being semi-decidable.          I. Algorithms exist that say yes to every entailed sentence         II. No algorithm exists that says no to every non-entailed sentence
The ________________ for a predicate variable is the set of values that may be assigned to the variable.
In First order logic, if a set of sentence is __________ then resolution will always be able to derive a contradiction.

Consider which of the following statements are correct w.r.t. satisfiability of logical sentences based on the logical operators involved.
I. Universally quantified sentence is satisfied if and only if the enclosed statement is satisfied for all assignments of the quantified variable.
II. Existentially quantified sentence is satisfied if and only if the enclosed statement is satisfied for few assignments of the quantified variable.

Consider the statement ¬(𝑃∧𝑄)≡(¬𝑃∨¬𝑄).
Identify which of the following are correct.

options.option: Formulas ¬(𝑃∧𝑄)≡(¬𝑃∨¬𝑄) have the same truth tables
The statement is a propositional formula which evaluates to a truth value
The statement means 'the two formulas are equivalent'

question:
Consider which of the following statements are correct w.r.t. nesting of quantifiers:
I. Switching the order of universal quantifiers does not change the meaning
∀𝑥∀𝑦𝑃(x,y)⇔∀𝑦∀𝑥𝑃(x,y)
II. Similarly, one can also switch the order of existential and universal quantifiers
∃𝑥∀𝑦𝑃(x,y)⇔∀𝑦∃𝑥𝑃(x,y)
The negation of a universal statement  (∀𝑥𝜑) is logically equivalent to the following existential statement
Formalization of knowledge in a declarative form begins with a _____________.
A conceptualization is a triple consisting of the following

options.option: a set of mappings from terms to objects
a functional basis set for that universe of discourse

question:
An interpretation I is a mapping between elements of the language and elements of a conceptualization.
Which of the following statements are true w.r.t an interpretation?

options.option: Used to name a specific element of a universe of discourse
Used as a mapping from terms to objects
Used to designate a function on members of the universe of discourse
Used to name a relation on the universe of discourse

question: An axiom is a well-formed formula that is asserted to be true without proof. In an AI system, the axioms would be:

options.option: The domain-specific knowledge rules in the database
The control strategy rules selected by the inference mechanism
The input data supplied by the user
The output data obtained through the inference process

question:
The notions of interpretation and variable assignment are important because they allow us to define a relative notion of truth called satisfaction.
Identify the statements which are true w.r.t satisfaction.

options.option: The definitions for satisfaction differs from one type of sentence to another
A sentence satisfied by one interpretation would be satisfied by any interpretations
Satisfiability is also dependent on interpretation
Satisfiability of logical sentences depends on the logical operators involved

question:
Consider which of the following statements are correct w.r.t. satisfiability of logical sentences based on the logical operators involved.
I. Universally quantified sentence is satisfied if and only if the enclosed statement is satisfied for all assignments of the quantified variable.
II. Existentially quantified sentence is satisfied if and only if the enclosed statement is satisfied for few assignments of the quantified variable.
___________ helps immensely in search as it dramatically reduces the number of resolvents that can be inferred from two input clauses.
Skolemization is a procedure for systematic elimination of the __________ in a first-order formula in a prenex form, by introducing new constant and functional symbols.

Consider the set {P(a, y), P(x, f(b))}. The set is unifiable. State whether the following statement is True or False.
θ = {a/x, f(b)/y} is a (most general) unifier for the set.

Any predicate calculus well-formed formula can be converted to a set of clauses.
State whether the following statement is True or False w.r.t the prenex form.
The prenex form consists of a string of quantifiers called prefix followed by a quantifier-free formula called the matrix.

Which of the following statements are correct w.r.t. entailment in first-order logic being semi-decidable?
I. Algorithms exist that say yes to every entailed sentence
II. No algorithm exists that says no to every non-entailed sentence

Under which of the following conditions, a clause {Li} subsumes a clause {Mi}, if there exists a substitution 's'?
Condition 1: {Li}s is a subset of {Mi} Condition 2: {Mi}s is a subset of {Li}

options.option: No clause ever subsumes another clause

question:
Answer extraction involves converting a refutation tree to a proof tree with statement at the root that can be used as an answer.
Which of the following are true w.r.t the above process of answer extraction?
I. Convert every clause arising from the negation of the goal well-formed formula into a tautology
II. The statement at the root of the Modified Proof Tree logically follows from the axioms and the tautologies
Rule of inference, called ___________ when added to resolution principle, guarantees refutation completeness, even when involving equality.

In answer extraction, we convert the question to a goal well-formed formula containing an existential quantifier.
The ___________ represents an answer to the question

Translate the following English sentence to First Order Logic.
Every horse registered for today's race has won a race this year

Translate the following English sentence to FOL.
A horse that has won a race this year is not a thoroughbred

P(c) for some element c ∃x P(x) We will be using this to prove statements of the form ∃x P(x).
This is _____________.

Within a logical-agent approach, agents almost never have access to the whole truth about their environment.
Agents must therefore act under uncertainty.

options.option: Incompleteness in the agent's understanding of the properties of the environment
Options, choices, and preferences of the properties of the environment
Use of formal language for representing and reasoning about the environment
Incorrectness in the agent's understanding of the properties of the environment

question: __________ provides ways and means of weighing up the desirability of goals and the likelihood of achieving them.

Belief networks is a powerful tool for representing and reasoning with uncertain knowledge.

options.option: A set of random variables makes up the nodes of the network
Some nodes have a conditional probability table that quantifies the effects that the parent nodes have on the node
It is a directed acyclic graph
A set of directed links or arrows connects pairs of nodes

question:
Modelling with Bayesian Networks require an assumption:
There are no direct dependencies in the system being modelled which are not already explicitly shown via arcs.
This is referred to as the ___________.

Decision Networks combine Bayesian Networks with _____________.

The term “free” is contained in 4.75% of all messages. 3.57% of all messages contain the word “free” and are marked as spam.
Find the probability that a message contains the word “free”, given that it is spam.
additional: Identification of spam emails and text message (so as to create a message-filter) can be accomplished using the Bayes' rule. A database of SMS from cellphone users contain 774 spam messages out of a total of 5574 message i.e., 13.40% are marked as spam.

question:
The term “free” is contained in 4.75% of all messages. 3.57% of all messages contain the word “free” and are marked as spam.
What is the probability that a message is spam, given that it contains the word “free”?
additional: Identification of spam emails and text message (so as to create a message-filter) can be accomplished using the Bayes' rule. A database of SMS from cellphone users contain 774 spam messages out of a total of 5574 message i.e., 13.40% are marked as spam.

question:
7.01% of all messages contains the word “text” (or “txt”). The word “text” (or “txt”) is contained in 38.55% of all spam messages.
Find the probability that a message is spam, given that it contains the word “text” (or “txt”).
additional:
Identification of spam emails and text message (so as to create a message-filter) can be accomplished using the Bayes' rule. A database of SMS from cellphone users contain 774 spam messages out of a total of 5574 message i.e., 13.40% are marked as spam.
The term “free” is contained in 4.75% of all messages. 3.57% of all messages contain the word “free” and are marked as spam.

question: Of all spam messages, 17.00% contain both the word “free” and the word “text” (or “txt”). Of all non-spam messages, 0.06% contain both the word “free” and the word “text” (or “txt”). Given that a message contains both the word “free” and the word “text” (or “txt”), what is the probability that it is spam?
additional:
Identification of spam emails and text message (so as to create a message-filter) can be accomplished using the Bayes' rule. A database of SMS from cellphone users contain 774 spam messages out of a total of 5574 message i.e., 13.40% are marked as spam.
The term “free” is contained in 4.75% of all messages. 3.57% of all messages contain the word “free” and are marked as spam.

question: Given that a message contains the word “free” but does NOT contain the word “text” (or “txt”), what is the probability that it is spam?
additional:
Identification of spam emails and text message (so as to create a message-filter) can be accomplished using the Bayes' rule. A database of SMS from cellphone users contain 774 spam messages out of a total of 5574 message i.e., 13.40% are marked as spam.
The term “free” is contained in 4.75% of all messages. 3.57% of all messages contain the word “free” and are marked as spam.

question:
Planning and problem solving methods can often solve the same sorts of problems.
Which of the following are true for differences between planning and problem solving?

options.option: Different in the representations of goals, states and actions
Problem solving is more powerful because of the representations and methods used
Different in the representation and construction of action sequences
Planning opens up the black-boxes by using logic to represent action, states and goals.

question:
Planning algorithms use descriptions in some formal language, usually first-order logic or a subset thereof.
The first key idea behind planning is to "open up " the representation of
Situation calculus is a dialect of First Order Logic. Which of the following statements hold for situation calculus?

options.option: Situations and actions are explicitly taken to be objects in the domain
Only way to represent beliefs about a changing world
Successor-state axiom specifies truth value of fluent in the next state as a function of the action and truth value in the current state

question:
Representing all that stays unchanged, needs to be accomplished in addition to describing what changes when an action is applied.
One must find an efficient solution for stating what doesn't change. This dilemma is referred to as the_______

STRIPS is an alternative representation to the pure situation calculus for planning
I. Actions are not represented explicitly as part of the world model
II. Actions are effectively instantaneous
III. Actions are thought of as operators that syntactically transform world models
Which of the above statements are correct?

STRIPS make use of a stack that contains both subgoals and actions that have been proposed to satisfy those subgoals.
It also relies on a database that describes the current situation, and a set of actions described by precondition, add and delete lists.
The reasoning strategy used by STRIPS is_________
Partially ordered plans are allowed as solutions using a simple definition: a solution is a complete, consistent plan. A solution plan is one in which:

options.option: Every precondition of every step is achieved by the effect of some other step
All possible clobberers have been suitably demoted or promoted
There are open preconditions in a consistent plan
There are no contradictions in the ordering constraints

question:
During the construction of the planning graph, information about the conflict between operators and literals within a layer is maintained
I. A conflict is called a mutex condition, which means that a pair of literal or pair of operators is mutually exclusive
II. For such a pair, both cannot be chosen simultaneously without leading to some kind of conflict
Which of the above statements are correct?
For each layer, a mutex relation is defined that indicates which pairs satisfy the mutex condition. A pair, o,o'∈𝑂𝑖 of operators is defined to be mutex if any of these conditions is met:

options.option: Inconsistent effects: An effect of o is the negated literal of an effect of o'
Interference: An effect of o is the negated literal of a precondition of o'
Trivial Operator: For each possible operator, o, a trivial operator is constructed for which, o' is the only precondition and effect.
Competing needs: A pair of preconditions, one from each of o and o', are mutex in layer Li

question:
GraphPlan is a two-phase algorithm: Planning Graph Construction followed by Solution Extraction.
Which of the following does the first stage achieve?

options.option: Check if a solution can be extracted
Some kind of reachability analysis  on the given problem
The graph is treated as a constraint satisfaction problem

question:
STRIPS is an alternative representation to the pure situation calculus for planning
I. Hierarchical Plans cannot be expressed in STRIPS
II. STRIPS operators are essentially propositional
III. Real world projects need a better model of time than that in STRIPS
Which of the above statements are correct?
In finding an abstract solution, and in rejecting other abstract plans as inconsistent, the downward solution property states that

options.option: If p is an abstract solution, then there is a primitive solution of which p is an abstraction
If p is an abstract solution, then there is a plan that contains abstract operators
If an abstract plan is inconsistent, then there is no primitive solution of which it is an abstraction
If p is an abstract solution, then abstract pieces can be combined hierarchically to create large plans

question:
A Markov Decision Process is a four tuple , where
S is the finite set of states,
A is the finite set of actions
and R is the cost or reward being in state s.
T is the transition model.

options.option: Probability of executing action a in state s at time t
Probability of s' at time t+1 , given action a in state s at time t
Probability of s at time t, given actions in states upto time t-1
Probability of executing action a in state s' at time t+1

question:
Sequential decision problems, which include utilities, uncertainty, and sensing, generalize the search and planning problems.
Transition model refers to the following:

options.option: Set of probabilities associated with the possible transitions between states after any given action
A complete mapping from states to actions
Function be specified for the agent in order to determine the value of an action
Specification of the outcome probabilities for each action in each possible state

question: _______ provides ways and means of weighing up the desirability of goals and the likelihood of achieving them.

Sensor model in a belief network is the conditional probability table associated with the percept node;
and show how reliable they are as sensors.
Which of the following statements are correct for a sensor model?

options.option: If the sensor gives a perfect report of the state, then the sensor model (the CPT) will be purely deterministic
If the sensor gives a perfect report of the state, then the sensor model (the CPT) will be purely probabilistic
In order for the system to handle sensor failure, the sensor model must include the possibility of failure; sensor failure in turn affects the sensor's accuracy
Sensor model describes how the environment generates the sensor data

question: Value Iteration is an algorithm for computing an optimal policy. The basic idea includes

options.option: Computing the utility of each state
Use state utilities to select an optimal action in each state
Calculate a new Maximum Expected Utility policy based on computed utilities
Start with a random policy and calculate utilities based on if that policy were executed

question:
Policy Iteration is an alternate algorithm for computing an optimal policy.
The basic idea includes

options.option: Computing the utility of each state
Use state utilities to select an optimal action in each state
Calculate a new Maximum Expected Utility policy based on computed utilities
Start with a random policy and calculate utilities based on if that policy were executed

question: Partially Observable Markov Decision Problems, or POMDP are characterized by the following conditions:

options.option: Percept does not provide enough information to determine the state or the associated transition probabilities
The Markov property does not hold for percepts (as opposed to states)
Calculating an optimal policy in an accessible, stochastic environment with a known transition model
Include the value of information as one component of the decision problem

question: ________________ provide a general, concise representation for large POMDP, so they can be used as inputs for any POMDP algorithm including value and policy iteration methods.
Of the two strands of Artificial Intelligence activity, the one that seeks to understand how intelligent behaviour arises is the__________

options.option: Presence of irrelevant attributes may lead to more degrees of freedom in the decision tree
Presence of irrelevant attributes may lead to hypothesis space which is unnecessary large
Decision Tree Pruning identifies attributes that are likely to be irrelevant
Overfitting makes use of irrelevant attributes to distinguish between samples that have no meaningful differences

question:

options.option: It basically helps to normalize the data within a particular range
Using transforms on variables to make their distribution more Gaussian
It is a step of Data Pre-processing which is applied to features of data

question:
Which of the following statements are correct for a Maximum Margin Classifier?
I. Best hyperplane is the one that represents the largest separation, or margin, between the two classes.
II. The linear classifier defined by the maximum-margin hyperplane is known as a maximum-margin classifier

I. Learning depends only on dot products of sample pairs.
II. Classification depends only on dot products of unknown with samples

options.option: It is an exponentially decaying function in the input feature space
The maximum value for the function is attained at the support vector
The function decays uniformly in all directions around the support vector

question: Why is clustering often called an unsupervised learning task?

options.option: It groups data instances that are similar to (near) each other
Partitioning is the most simple and basic version of cluster analysis
No class values denoting an a priori grouping of the data instances are given
Only the feature vectors representing different objects/instances/ records or situations are known

question:

This leads to __________ clustering

a ___________ can be thought of as multiple copies of the same network, each network passing a message to a successor

I. The convolution layers help the network retain the spatial arrangement of pixels that is present in any image
II. The pooling layers allow the network to summarize the pixel information

Learning in a multi-layer network proceeds the same way as for perceptron;
Identify which of the following statements are true for the back-propagation algorithm?

options.option: Essentially performs gradient-descent search on the error surface
Finds a mapping from state/action pairs to values
One of the simplest and most general methods used for supervised training of  multilayered networks

question:

I. A policy is the agent's behaviour and is a map from state to action
II. Value function is a prediction of the next state
III. A model is the agent's representation of the environment and predicts what the agent will do next

options.option: Computing the utility of each state
Use state utilities to select an optimal action in each state
Calculate a new Maximum Expected Utility policy based on computed utilities
Start with a random policy and calculate utilities based on if that policy were executed

question:
A key difference between traditional Machine Learning (ML) and Deep Learning (DL) is in how features are extracted.
Which of the following statements are true?
I. Traditional ML approaches use handcrafted engineering features by applying several feature extraction algorithms, and then apply the learning algorithms
II. In the case of DL, the features are learned automatically and are represented hierarchically in multiple levels

Deep Learning (DL) which uses either deep architectures of learning or hierarchical learning approaches is a class of Machine Learning (ML).
Identify the correct statements below

options.option: DL approaches do not require precisely defined features
Traditional ML approaches uses handcrafted engineering features by applying several feature extraction algorithms and then apply the learning algorithm
In DL, the features are learned automatically and represented hierarchically in multi levels
The DL approach is not scalable
